intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum var. auriculatum, commonly known as the auriculate leucanthemum, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive, rounded, ear-like shape at the base of the petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
